TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Some may remember me mention a while back about a third and final Tantares mod, focused on small scale ISRU and colony style habitats.

Currently I'm experimenting with the Regolith, but the final version will certainly run on the stock system.

I got a little tired of placeholder models, so here's the resource canister, the "drill-bit" will follow shortly

http://puu.sh/gcDyJ/e67889a7b9.jpg

http://puu.sh/gcDzP/88d0f4b64d.jpg

http://puu.sh/gcDAH/c4cb16f5a1.jpg

Also planned is a generic "Luna Glob" landing Bus, to get the equipment to the surface. I guess something similar to a bigger Fobos Grunt.

http://puu.sh/gcEzs/ae32d6b49e.jpg

I wasn't particularly hyped about the resources system planned for 1.0... until now

I wasn't particularly hyped about the resources system planned for 1.0... until now

Hehe!

That's great.

I'm kind of looking to do small scale ISRU like this:

Or:

As I feel the stock system (from what we've seen so far) will probably be quite a medium/large operation.

Here's a few (tiny) shots of some of the Lunny Poligon concepts. You can appreciate the "outpost" feeling.

Really nice small inflatable habitat. The question of "what happens when you deflate something with Kerbals inside" is difficult to answer without using plugins, but I'm seeing what can be done.

Actually it's good to mention, the real Lunny Poligon concept is totally un-manned, so that's probably not a habitat for humans. But the appearance is still good.

Unrelated and off-topic, but Ceres looks hella cool!

I super-imposed the original Hubble observations to try and get a colour version, though It's probably hugely inaccurate.

Edited February 25, 2015 by Beale

ooh, that looks fun!

Oho! I should have won this contest, because I have acctually flown an N1 stack (Block A/B/V/G, stock fueled 2.5 to 1.25 adapter) into orbit. LAST SUNDAY. hahaha pTrevTrevs, I win.

Evidencias:

http://i1243.photobucket.com/albums/gg559/bien_vincent/screenshot364_zpsvpziclzk.png

http://i1243.photobucket.com/albums/gg559/bien_vincent/screenshot366_zpsfmbs8lug.png

Cheers, flamerboy67664/SpaceEagle

PS. pTrevsTrevs, Beale should decide who wins among us 2

From what I understood, Beale's challenge was to insert a fully fueled Block A tank into Kerbin orbit without using cheats. My challenge is to insert an entire N1 rocket into orbit, also fully fueled, as a payload.

Tricky, tricky... The question is, does the whole stack have to be fueled? o.O

Of course! What kind of challenge would it be if it weren't?

Can I use a modded (realistic) superbooster and RSS?

I suppose so, although it seems like it would be easier in normal scaled KSP. Oh well, more bragging rights for you if you do it in RSS!

Sorry for taking so long to respond, but like most people, I have a life away from my computer/ phone.

I'm not entirely sure that it is possible to complete my challenge, I guess the only way to find out is to try it myself! Prepare yourselves...

The legs: Yeah, I want to do this in particular very much.

Will the legs be separable from Blok E?

Also awesome, Lunny Poligon!

Will the legs be separable from Blok E?

Also awesome, Lunny Poligon!

Yep - Meaning I have to get my head around the suspension-leg module setup. But that's the plan.

Many thanks!

Mk II, in final testing stages. I have not yet perfected the landings, and had to add a fair amount to allow control in all phases of flight. (I can't help but think, "Wouldn't this be CRAZY expensive?!?")
DO NOT DOWNLOAD BAD ROCKET FROM GREEDY AMERICAN, DOWNLOAD GLORIOUS ROCKET FROM SOVIET BEALE! (caps)

Erm...

First successful mission of my N1-MOK. Delivery of an adapter docking port to the "Salute" station previously launched by ROMBUS.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

You thought about it.... You were afraid of it... You asked to stop, calling the whole idea insane... BEHOLD:

RO-fied N-1!

ZAHZHIGANIYE!

30 seconds, device is stable!

133 seconds, Block A separated!

239 seconds, Block B separated!

Block G fixing the mess after the Block V

Test Payload finally in orbit

You thought about it.... You were afraid of it... You asked to stop, calling the whole idea insane... BEHOLD:

RO-fied N-1!

How much does that behemoth weigh on the launch pad?

How much does that behemoth weigh on the launch pad?

Like the real one, around 2.9 kilotons.

It will also have thrust control to simulate KORD system, which turns off engines to lower thrust.

I will upload the configs after I finish Gemini, V2 (for fun purpose) and ATV (waited too long with that one). Also, RealFuel configs will be modified (thanks to SpaceHungryMan for the support of new stuff).

LK will be not made until the planned overhaul, Fuji has too few information about it, but I will add something in future versions.

Erm...

First successful mission of my N1-MOK. Delivery of an adapter docking port to the "Salute" station previously launched by ROMBUS.

http://imgur.com/a/M5lSD

This is really nice, and I'm not usually so crazy about spaceplanes.

Is it basically an SSTO? Or does the plane make the final orbit.

Like the real one, around 2.9 kilotons.

It will also have thrust control to simulate KORD system, which turns off engines to lower thrust.

I will upload the configs after I finish Gemini, V2 (for fun purpose) and ATV (waited too long with that one). Also, RealFuel configs will be modified (thanks to SpaceHungryMan for the support of new stuff).

LK will be not made until the planned overhaul, Fuji has too few information about it, but I will add something in future versions.

It's mega-big

Many thanks!

Fuji: It is obscure, I may myself just straight away copy the Soyuz configs somewhat and apply them to Fuji. I think it ran on UDMH/NTO, eh, but I am not so sure.

You thought about it.... You were afraid of it... You asked to stop, calling the whole idea insane... BEHOLD:

RO-fied N-1!

Can you get to mars (duna) with this?

Can you get to mars (duna) with this?

Should be able to send something (reasonably) large to Duna. But not quite a manned landing.

Edit: I speak a lie, actually my last manned trip to Duna was N-1 launched, but it was one way only.

To add to that, here's a great render done of the LK. I can't speak to it's accuracy, but it's impressive. There's a good chance you've already seen it, if so, this is for anyone who hasn't seen it:

Regarding the LK's EVA hatch, since you're not strictly sticking the the stock hatch design anymore, is there any chance you'll go for a more rounded hatch design for the LK, or are you trying to keep things simple and unified?

P.S: Here's a great forum post of a guy paper-modeling a 7K-LOK with an LK. May or may not be helpful, but still an interesting read.
